You guys should come to Northern Norway and ser how real plows are made GMI plows or maybe Saltvik or other companies that make real plows. All of the snow clearances videos I have watched from the states or Canada have been plows that is jumping and making “washing boards”
The Boss plow factory is right down the road from me

I did notice one thing wrong with this, they generalized all snow plows as metal, and said they can be stainless steel or carbon steel. That is incorrect - a lot of plows are being made out of polyethylene (plastic). A lot of cutting edges are still made out of metal, which is the part that comes in contact with the ground. Metal holds up better in that part, but polyethylene lasts longer as the moldboard.
